p: Based on the obtained scoring results, compounds Ve, VIa, and Vd showed the highest binding affinity to the VEGFR-2 active site. Compound Ve was the best among the synthesised compounds with docking score (–7.9154 kcal/mol) compared to the reference ligand Sorafenib docking score (–11.1354 kcal/mol), and it formed a direct interaction in the active site, similar to that of Sorafenib. Also, compounds VIa and Vd showed a good docking score (–7.4371 kcal/mol) and (–7.3974 kcal/mol), respectively, compared to Sorafenib. Figure 5 reveals that the tested compounds VIa and Vd along with Sorafenib reacted with important amino acids in the active binding site. The carbonyl group of the chalcone moiety in both compounds Ve and Vd acts as H-bond acceptor and formed a H-bonding with LYS868 ( Figure 5(a,b)). On the other hand, the reference compound Sorafenib formed several hydrogen bonding with the active side nearby amino acids GLU885, CYS919, ASP1046, and PHE1047 ( Figure 5(c)).
